title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Honeyed peach and rose petal notes dominate nose and palate. The rose perfume seems even more amplified on the rounded, off-dry and generous palate. Drink this while aromas are at their very peak.

title: Angels & Cowboys 2016 Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: This is a delightfully light-pink blend of Grenache, Merlot, Sangiovese and Syrah from different pockets of the county. Subtle strawberry, Mandarin orange and nutty flavors play off the moderate acidity and pretty white flower notions.

title: Artadi 2014  Rioja
description: This wine's ripe berry aromas include a hint of iodine. Its chunky palate lacks precision, tasting of coffee and nondescript berry fruit flavors. The finish is dense and round but lacks focus.

title: Donnafugata 2016 Anthilia White (Sicilia)
description: Bright and juicy, this opens with heady aromas of fragrant white flower, citrus and ripe orchard fruit. Mirroring the nose, the fresh palate doles out mature apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine zest alongside a note of Mediterranean scrub.

title: Donnafugata 2016 Lighea Zibibbo (Sicilia)
description: Here's a refreshing white made with Zibibbo grapes that opens with scents suggesting ripe apricot and wild rose. The bright palate offers juicy yellow peach, citrus and a note of Mediterranean brush. It has a crisp clean finish.

title: Fidelitas 2014 Optu Red (Red Mountain)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (73%) makes up the majority of this wine, with the rest filled out by Merlot (15%), Petit Verdot (8%) and Cabernet Franc. Anise, woodspice and herb aromas are at the fore, leaning a bit into the green. The palate is light and elegant, with the tannins bringing a fair amount of grittiness. It needs some food to keep them in check.

title: F2F 2014 Red (Thracian Valley)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Regent, this garnet-colored wine has aromas of cherry vanilla, eucalyptus and tobacco leaf. Flavors of mocha and blackberry lead to a balanced finish.

title: Fleur de Charme 2015  Sauternes
description: This honeyed wine from a good Sauternes year is rich. Touches of botrytis give it a dry edge and stop it from being cloying. In the background, the acidity finishes with a lift. Drink from 2018.

title: Luna 2014 Winemaker's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This juicy and simple blend of 40% Merlot with Syrah, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon offers chewy, dense tannins and a lingering spiciness of leather and tobacco.

title: Montonale 2016 Montunal  (Lugana)
description: Spring blossom, white stone-fruit and citrus aromas come together on this. The bright fresh palate offers green apple, citrus zest and white peach while a hint of almond gives it a pleasantly bitter finish.

title: Jaxon 2014 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: High-toned aromatics emphasize baking spices (the wine spent two years in mostly neutral oak). Light red fruits fill in the rest. The flavors recall a morning glory breakfast muffin done as a red wine.

title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2016 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: A touch of yeasty funk still clings to the pear-fruit nose. The palate brims with ripe juicy pear, helped along by some residual sweetness, and is contained by a pleasantly bitter zestiness. The body is slender but rounded and pervasive. A lively freshness lets it finish dry.

title: Jidvei 2014 Ana Owner's Choice Chardonnay (Jidvei)
description: Creamy in the mouth with flavors of mango, pineapple and apple, this wine entices with a subtle bouquet of citrus pith, Delicious apple and vanilla bean. The finish is smooth and round, yet clean.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a classic dry Vinho Verde. It has delicious fruit and crisp acidity giving lemon flavors, a lively texture and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Heady aromas suggesting tropical fruit, honeysuckle and citrus zest lead the nose. Bright and refreshing, the lively palate offers mature white stone fruit, tangerine peel and a pleasantly bitter-almond note.

title: Ribbon Cliff 2012 Estate Reserve Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sangiovese makes up 45% of this blend, with the balance Barbera (22%), Malbec (22%) and Cabernet Franc. The barrel treatment is at the fore, with notes of baking spice and vanilla that are followed by aromas of dried cherry and herb. The palate is full bodied, loaded with appealing tart cranberry and cherry flavors.

title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Classic and restrained, with herbal components and a firm tannic backbone, this is a finely made wine at a respectable price that's easy to enjoy and share. Savory currant, leather and oak define it best.

title: Owen Roe 2014 Red Willow Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Cabernet Franc makes up just under half of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Barrel-spice aromas are in the lead followed by cherry, flower, apple and herb. The cherry flavors are medium bodied, backed by lightly gritty tannins.

title: Pali 2015 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black plum, black raspberry, rose petal and wet graphite aromas show on the nose of this always reliable and well-priced bottling from the Lompoc-based winery. Earthy mushroom and loam flavors meet graphite and tangy raspberry notes on the palate.

title: Silenus 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: The addition of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Cabernet Franc add an apparent spiciness and structure to this young, tightly wound wine that's otherwise showy with oak and savory clove notes. Firm tannins and a strong streak of dried herb and cedar add to the mix.

title: Quinta das Marias 2015 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)
description: This pure Touriga Nacional is full of black-currant fruit. Along with its mineral texture it has some good aging ability as well as the richness. Maybe a little less wood aging would have helped bring out the obvious fruitiness and fruit tannins of this wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta das Marias 2016 Encruzado (Dão)
description: The wine is all attractive fruit and crisp acidity. The lemon and ripe apple flavors are fed through this acidity to give a great lift to the creamy texture. Drink from late 2017.

title: Pierre Sparr 2015 Grande Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Mellow notes of ripe pear and fresh earth combine on the nose. The palate majors in ripe juicy pears, boosted by a touch of residual sweetness. The aromas are fresh and easy. Drink this while they are at their peak. The finish is just off dry.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Bruberry Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: The modest cherry and raspberry aromas in this Carignan-Garnacha blend set up a buoyant palate with tight, rubbery tannins. It offers generic but sound berry fruit flavors and some oak. Chewy tannins mark the finish.

title: Vie di Romans 2015 Dessimis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)
description: This copper-colored Pinot Grigio (a result of brief skin contact) offers subdued aromas suggesting yellow flower, toasted nut and citrus zest. Aged in barriques, the linear, rather lean palate offers oak, coconut, lemon and a note of bitter nut while a saline note wraps up the finish. Not your typical Pinot Grigio for sure.

title: Vincze Béla 2013 Rosszfiú Cuveé Red (Eger)
description: This Hungarian red blend has aromas of red raspberry, black cherry and violets. In the mouth there are flavors of cranberry, pomegranate and black plum. The finish is slightly astringent but persistent.

title: Three Rivers 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Brooding aromas of toast, cocoa, cherry, barrel spice and fresh herb are followed by dry, full black-fruit flavors with bitters on the finish. The tannins are quite firm, even a bit dry, and need some time to unwind. Best after 2021.

title: Toros 2008 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Aromas of eucalyptus, citrus zest, dill and a menthol note emerge on this nine-year-old white. While it's still interesting and surprisingly fresh for its age, with notes of lemon peel, grapefruit and salty mineral, I would have loved to try this in its prime four or five years ago.

title: Tosalet 2014 Vinyes Velles Red (Priorat)
description: The fiery cherry and cassis aromas in this snappy wine include a rubbery Band-Aid note. Roasted tomato, plum and currant flavors are framed by lip-smacking tannins and tomato-like acidity, finishing with gritty intensity.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2013 Boar's Camp Kick Ranch Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blend of nearly equal parts Mourvèdre, Grenache and Syrah is food-friendly and approachable, with smoked meat, blueberry jam and cherry highlights, the oak thick and slightly reductive.
